notesStmt.note: Folio 1 is conjoined to upper pastedown; lower pastedown is conjoined to folio 122 as part of the final duernion
De Ricci, Seymour, with the assistance of W. J. Wilson, Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada, vol. 2 (New York,: H. W. Wilson, 1935-40), p. 2050, no. 138.

Free Library of Philadelphia, A Descriptive Catalogue of the John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts in the Free Library of Philadelphia, compiled by Edwin Wolf, 2nd, with an introduction by Dr. A.S.W. Rosenbach (Philadelphia: The Free Library, 1937), pp. 32-33, no. 26.

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This early-fifteenth-century manuscript, possibly written in Flanders, contains three theological treatises. The first is Saint Bernard's De consideratione, the second is the De colloquio symonis et ihesu and the third is the De amore dei. A table of contents on fol. 1v attributes the three texts to Saint Bernard of Clairvaux but the second text is now thought to be by an anonymous author and the third is attributed to William of Saint-Thierry. The table of contents on fol. 1v also contains two additional titles which have been rubbed out and removed from the volume, as well as a rubbed-out ownership or library inscription.

msItem.title: De consideratione (On Consideration)
msItem.author: Bernard, of Clairvaux, Saint, 1090 or 1091-1153
William, of Saint-Thierry, Abbot of Saint-Thierry, approximately 1085-1148?

msItem.title: Prologue and list of chapters for De colloquio symonis et ihesu
De amore dei
msItem.explicit: et sepe fiunt primi novissimi et novissimi primi. [fol. 124r]

supportDesc.extent: 124; 234 x 164 mm bound to 242 x 172 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto

p.signatures: Original alphanumeric signatures visible in lower right corner of most rectos

p.catchwords: Regular horizontal catchwords in lower right corners (some trimmed) at fols.: 9v, 17v, 25v, 33v, 41v, 49v, 57v, 65v, 73v, 81v, 89v, 97v, 105v, 113v, 121v

layoutDesc.layout: One column of twenty-seven lines; ruled in black ink; written area: 159 x 106 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Ornamental initials in red and blue with marginal penwork extensions; rubrication and capitals touched up in red
Inside front coverBookplate, John Frederick Lewis

origin.p: Rubbed-out ownership/library inscription on fol. 1v; early 15th century

history.provenance: De Ricci states: "N. 459 in an English bookseller's cat. (Thorp?)"; John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936
